model_solution:
Step 1: The problem asks us to compute $\dbinom{25}{2}$, which is a combination (choosing 2 items from a set of 25). We will use the formula $\dbinom{n}{r} = \dfrac{n!}{r!(n-r)!}$, where $n!$ denotes the factorial of $n$.
Step 2: Calculate the factorials $25!$, $2!$ and $23!$ in the formula for $\dbinom{25}{2}$.
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25!}{2!(25-2)!}$
Step 3:
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25!}{2!(25-2)!} = \dfrac{25!}{2!23!}$
Step 4: Simplify the expression by canceling out common factors in the numerator and denominator.
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24 \times 23!}{2 \times 1 \times 23!}$
Step 5: 
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24 \times 23!}{2 \times 1 \times 23!} = \dfrac{25 \times 24}{2}$
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24}{2} = 300$
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24 \times 23!}{2 \times 1 \times 23!} = \dfrac{25 \times 24}{2} = 150 \times 2$
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24 \times 23!}{2 \times 1 \times 23!} = \dfrac{25 \times 24}{2} = 150 \times 2$

Step 4: Simplify the expression by canceling out common factors in the numerator and denominator.
$\dbinom{25}{2} = \dfrac{25 \times 24 \times 23!}{2 \times 1 \times 23!}$
